results.title: The Unvanquished = Aparajito
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Bibhutibhushan Banerji, this is the second part of the trilogy begun by Pather Panchali. Apu grows up and becomes restless for experience. Set in Benares in the 1920’s, the focus is on the changing environment, contrasted with the stasis of village life in Pather Panchali. Apu’s restlessness and desire for more education brings him into conflict with his mother. This realistic portrayal of family life drew a good deal of criticism from the middle class audience of the time.

results.title: King and country
results.creator_credit: Joseph Losey and B H E Productions
results.brief_description: Amidst the mud and blood of Passchendaele in 1917 Private Hamp awaits court martial for desertion. His crime? Simply walking away from the slaughter after three solid years at the front during which all his mates have been killed. Starring Dirk Bogarde, Tom Courtney and Leo McKern. According to Felix Barber of the Evening News, “This film is not only going to be regarded as one of the half-dozen greatest war films ever made; it is going into the select gallery of screen classics”.

results.title: Exploring the heart and mind
results.creator_credit: Leslie Ann Nathan, Eve Cotton and Center for Humanities
results.brief_description: This program discusses the Expressionist and Surrealist artists who sought to reveal deep feelings and subconscious thoughts in their painting. It includes work by Rousseau, Redon, Rouault, Matisse, Nolde, Kirchner, Kandinski and others.

results.title: The Reconstruction of space
results.creator_credit: Eve Cotton and Center for Humanities
results.brief_description: This program highlights a major category of modern art - Cubism - and traces the influence of Cezanne’s cubistic style on Picasso and Braque.

results.title: Islands in the sky: the search for the Black Tree Kangaroo
results.creator_credit: Gary Steer, ABC-TV (Australia) and Sky Visuals
results.brief_description: Set in colourful Papua New Guinea, Tim Flannery, while ill, was being carried from the mountains when he noticed one of the stretcher bearers wore a black claw as pendant. This was the first piece in a biological detective story to locate a completely new species of mammal. Tim searched for 7 years until he found the Black Tree Kangaroo, or “Tenkile”. This creature had never been filmed before. It was one of the many animal survivors “marooned” on ecological islands in the sky, rainforest peaks isolated from lowland environments.

results.title: Jane Edmanson's guide to houseplants
results.creator_credit: Ernest Heffelmyer, ABC-TV (Australia) and Gardening Australia Magazine
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Gardening Australia”.
Jane Edmandson hosts this “Gardening Australia” special on houseplants which covers plant selection, containers and accessories, maintenance, repotting, dealing effectively with pests and diseases, over and underwatering, propagation by cuttings and division, popular flowering and foliage plants, unusual plants such as cacti, orchids and Bonsai, terrariums, holiday care and plant scaping.

results.title: Australian women's heritage: 1788-1901
results.brief_description: This visual history of Australian women documents the contribution of a previously overlooked group. Their work, their mothering and their civilising influence has been a major factor in Australia’s coming of age. This program begins with the daily life of Aboriginal women and also discusses issues important to these women later in the 19th Century. Also examines convict and free women; women’s contributions and life during the gold rush; fashion, education and family size, the impact of the 1890’s depression on women. Some individual women highlighted on this video are Mary Reiby, Caroline Chisholm, Louisa Lawson, Catherine Spence, Dame Nellie Melba, Mother Mary Mackillop, Truganini and Daisy Bates.

results.title: A guide to landscape painting with Del Newport
results.creator_credit: Leigh Kidd, Robert Dunn, Val Osborn and Coral Coast Video
results.brief_description: Del Newport, prominent teacher and exhibition artist with national and overseas recognition shows step by step the fine detail and intricacies of landscape painting. As she paints a landscape from memory, Del explains what she is doing and why.

results.title: The Good woman of Bangkok
results.creator_credit: Dennis O'Rourke and O'Rourke and Associates Filmakers
results.brief_description: This disturbing and controversial portrait of Aoi, a reluctant prostitute on the streets of Bangkok, is a very personal piece of work from filmmmaker Dennis O’Rourke. The soul of this young woman is captured as she shares her life story with the camera as much as with the filmmaker. O’Rourke picked her up in a bar and paid a pimp for her services. They stayed in a cheap motel in the red-light district. What proceeds to be laid bare, is a searing portrait of prostitution and the self-loathing that it helps breed.
